title: How to Keep Curly Hair Healthy

steps.headline: Condition your curly hair.
steps.description: Conditioning may be the most important thing you can do for curly hair. Curly hair is already more prone to dryness and damage/breakage than other types. So keeping it moisturized with conditioner is essential for healthy curly hair. You can condition your hair while in the shower, or try some leave-in conditioner.

steps.headline: Use shampoo/conditioner for heat damaged hair.
steps.description: These products will likely contain the same ingredients as products designated for curly hair. They’ll target the dryness and breakages, and that’s what matters.

steps.headline: Avoid products with alcohol or silicone.
steps.description: These ingredients will dry your hair out even more and lead to more damage. Many hair products are alcohol and silicone free; you just have to look at the labels to figure out which ones are.

steps.headline: Try the dry/no shampoo method.
steps.description: Many experts swear by the dry/no shampoo method. This is when you wash your hair with just water, or you only use conditioner in the shower (but no shampoo). This is meant to help your hair combat dryness and breakage.

steps.headline: Start in the shower.
steps.description: Put products on your sopping wet hair, even before you pat it dry with a towel. This will help your hair maintain as much of the moisture as possible from the water. EXPERT TIP																															Michael Van den Abbeel																Owner, Mosaic Hair Studio								Michael Van den Abbeel is the owner of Mosaic Hair Studio and Blowout Bar, a hair salon in Orlando, Florida. He has been cutting, styling, and coloring hair for over 17 years. Michael Van den Abbeel			Owner, Mosaic Hair Studio				Don't use your fingers to separate your curls after you wash your hair. Michael Van den Abbeel, the owner of Mosaic Hair Studio, says: "Detangle your hair in the shower with a wide-tooth comb, then wash your hair. After you rinse out the shampoo, scrunch a leave-in conditioner into your hair while it's wet. Then, open your hands and let go of your curls. Don't run your fingers through your hair after that, because you don't want to separate your curls. Air dry your hair, or you can use a blowdryer with a diffuser if you want a little more volume and lift."

steps.headline: Use smaller amounts of product.
steps.description: When it comes to styling products, less is more. The less you put in your hair, the less greasy/oily buildup you’ll have to work against later. For styling serums, use a quarter-sized amount; for mousse, use a golf ball-sized amount.

steps.headline: Refresh your curls between washes.
steps.description: Simply comb out your dry hair and spray it with a mixture that is half water and half leave-in conditioner. Comb the product into your hair, from the roots down, and then let your hair air dry. This will keep your curls looking fresh.

steps.headline: Avoid heat.
steps.description: Products like hairdryers and hair straighteners are great for people with curly hair who want to switch their style up, but they are terrible at damaging and drying out hair. If you use these heat-based products on a regular basis, you will get more split ends and damaged hair. Try to avoid drying and straightening your hair as much as possible. Using a diffuser to dry your hair is better because it will not damage your hair as badly as a hairdryer.

steps.headline: Pat your hair dry with a towel.
steps.description: Don't towel dry your hair; only dab the towel over your hair to soak up water. This prevents tangles and breaks. You can then brush your hair out with a wide-tooth comb.

steps.headline: Avoid brushing your hair.
steps.description: Brushing curly hair is a bad idea because it can break the strands and further damage your hair. Try to use a wide-toothed comb to gently detangle your hair instead of ripping through tangles with a brush.

steps.headline: Protect against chlorine.
steps.description: Swimming is a fun summertime activity, but if you have curly hair the chlorine can be very harmful. If you go swimming, make sure you use a shampoo and conditioner that helps against chlorine damage to your hair.

steps.headline: Get a haircut when your hair is dry.
steps.description: Curly hair can lose a lot of its length from the curl itself. So make sure your stylist cuts your hair when it is fully dry so you know that you’re getting the style you want.

steps.headline: Use a satin pillowcase.
steps.description: Cotton pillowcases soak up moisture from your (already dry) curly hair, so try using a satin or silk pillowcase instead. This will also prevent friction and breakage while you sleep.
